facts.fact_text: Silver slumped as much as 16.5% to around $73.5 per ounce.

evidences.evidence_text: Silver slumped as much as 16.5% to around $73.5 per ounce

facts.fact_text: US labour signals deteriorated, including 108.4K job cuts in January.

evidences.evidence_text: The move unfolded alongside deteriorating US labour signals, including 108.4K job cuts in January
a jump in initial claims to 231K

claims.claim_text: Deteriorating US labor signals reinforced expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts later this year.

evidences.evidence_text: The move unfolded alongside deteriorating US labour signals, including 108.4K job cuts in January and a jump in initial claims to 231K, which reinforced expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts later this year.

claims.claim_text: Policy uncertainty lingered as markets weighed Kevin Warsh’s nomination as Fed chair.

evidences.evidence_text: Policy uncertainty also lingered as markets weighed Kevin Warsh’s nomination as Fed chair, given his preference for a smaller balance sheet and a more cautious approach to easing.

evidence.evidence_text: Even so, the immediate response favoured risk reduction rather than defensive inflows, pressuring silver through margin driven selling after last week’s sharp rally.

The move unfolded alongside deteriorating US labour signals, including 108.4K job cuts in January and a jump in initial claims to 231K, which reinforced expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts later this year.
Meanwhile, easing geopolitical risk after confirmation of upcoming US Iran talks reduced near term safe haven demand.
